edge: The Grand Budapest Hotel is a 2014 comedy-drama film written, directed, and co-produced by Wes Anderson.
Wes Anderson wrote, directed, and co-produced The Grand Budapest Hotel in 2014.
Ralph Fiennes plays the role of Monsieur Gustave H., a famed concierge, in The Grand Budapest Hotel.
Tilda Swinton plays the role of a wealthy dowager in The Grand Budapest Hotel, who is later found murdered.
The Grand Budapest Hotel is set in the fictional Eastern European country of Zubrowka, where Monsieur Gustave H. Is a concierge at a mountainside resort.
In The Grand Budapest Hotel, Monsieur Gustave H. Has a relationship with the wealthy dowager who later meets a mysterious fate.
In The Grand Budapest Hotel, Tony Revolori plays the role of Zero, who is recently befriended by Monsieur Gustave H.
Fox Searchlight supervised the commercial distribution of The Grand Budapest Hotel in 2014.
The Grand Budapest Hotel was produced by Indian Paintbrush in association with Studio Babelsberg and American Empirical Pictures.

The Grand Budapest Hotel was co-produced by Indian Paintbrush, Scott Rudin, and Steven Rales.

The Grand Budapest Hotel opened to a $202,792-per theater average from a four-theater $811,166 overall gross in the United States, breaking the record for most robust live-action limited release previously held by Paul Thomas Anderson's The Master (2012). This early box office success can be attributed to fading interest in films hoping to capitalize on Academy Awards prestige and its crossover appeal to younger, casual moviegoers.
